meanings.definition: The state of being complete or whole.
meanings.sent1: The entireness of the puzzle was evident once all the pieces were put together.
meanings.sent2: She admired the entireness of the beautiful painting hanging on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the entireness of the rope remaining uncut.
meanings.sent4: The entireness of the forest enveloped her in a sense of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The entireness of the library's collection amazed the visitors.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unbroken or undivided.
meanings.sent1: The entireness of the glass was crucial to its function as a container.
meanings.sent2: He marveled at the entireness of the ancient vase, free from any cracks.
meanings.sent3: The entireness of the silence in the room made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent4: The entireness of the team's unity was key to their success.
meanings.sent5: The entireness of the melody captivated the audience.
